ad_rewarded: No ads for the next five minutes!
feedback_instructions:
We appreciate if you provide feedback on how we can improve the app.
If you encountered an error, please provide as many details as possible to help us solve it.
If you want to give us advice on new features we'll be happy to hear them.
Thank you!
Note: Nothing will be shared with third parties.
format_instructions:
Note that if you're using the web version of this app only xml files are enabled, since images in cards are not supported for now. To see an example of how to format the XML file try creating a deck and exporting it.To add more lines to the same card side, use the tag
. The ZIP file should contain an XML file with the same format and the media files in the same directory.The Zip file mustn't contain subdirectories. To create a ZIP file without subdirectories:Windows: right-click on Explorer > New > Compressed (zipped) folder. Then drag and drop (or copy and paste) the XML file and media files into the ZIP file.
guide_content:
To get started try following these simple steps:
1. From the decks page push the button on the bottom right with the + symbol. You'll be taken to the new deck creation page, you just have to assign it the name you prefer.
2. Once the deck is created you just have to push on the deck name to be taken to the dedicated page. From here you can manage every aspect of your newly created deck, like accessing the settings or managing your cards!
3. Push on the button on the bottom right and then on the button to add a new card. You'll be asked to input text for the front and back of the card, as well as images if you prefer.
4. After creating all the cards you prefer you can review them using the menu on the bottom right. Here you'll be prompted to assign a review to each card based on your preparedness level, the easier ones will be shown less frequently.

From here on you can have fun using our app to learn everything you want and discover the remaining features that are offered.
guide_installation_content:
Android: Download the APK and install it on your device. If you've never installed an APK before, you may need to enable installation from unknown sources in your device settings.
IOS: Download the IPA and install it on your device. If you've never installed an IPA file before, you can find a guide at the following link:
